holidays.name: National Look-Alike Day
holidays.description: A day to find your doppelganger or dress up as your favorite celebrity and see if people can spot the resemblance.
holidays.origin: Originated in the US as a fun unofficial celebration encouraging people to embrace their twin-like similarities or quirky impersonations.
holidays.funFact: Some companies have leveraged this day for marketing by pairing employees or customers who look alike to promote products.

holidays.name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to the melted, cheesy, toasted sandwich that warms the soul and satisfies hunger.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday celebrated by sandwich lovers and comfort food fans worldwide.
holidays.funFact: The classic grilled cheese was a staple during the Great Depression due to its low cost and satisfying nature.

holidays.name: Cannabis Day (420)
holidays.description: An informal counterculture holiday celebrating cannabis consumption and advocacy for legalization and reform.
holidays.origin: The term '420' originated from a group of California teenagers in the 1970s who used '420' as a code for smoking marijuana.
holidays.funFact: April 20 (4/20) has become a worldwide day for cannabis festivals and protests.

holidays.name: Cheese Doodle Day
holidays.description: A crunchy, cheesy snack celebration honoring the iconic orange cheese puffs loved by many.
holidays.origin: An unofficial food holiday created by snack enthusiasts to appreciate this cheesy finger food.
holidays.funFact: Cheese doodles were invented accidentally in the 1930s when a machine broke down, leading to their unique shape.
